Package io.github.jspinak.brobot.imageUtils

Class MatOps3d

java.lang.Object
io.github.jspinak.brobot.imageUtils.MatOps3d
@Component public class MatOps3d extends Object
3d versions of common OpenCV operations that only accept one channel.

  • Method Details

    • vConcatToSingleColumnPerChannel

      public org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat vConcatToSingleColumnPerChannel(List<org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat> mats)
      Combine a list of 3 channel Mats into a single 3 channel Mat with one column per channel. Brobot Images can have multiple image files associates with them. Therefore, to analyze the combined pixels across all image files, we need to aggregate them into one column per channel. This is because each image file will likely have a different size.
      Parameters:
      mats - the list of Mats to concatenate
      Returns:
      the concatenated Mat

    • kMeans

      public double[] kMeans(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat image, int numberOfCenters, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat labels, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.TermCriteria termCriteria, int attempts, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat centers)
      Sets 3d labels and centers for k-means clustering.
      Parameters:
      image - the image to cluster
      numberOfCenters - the number of clusters
      labels - the output labels
      termCriteria - the termination criteria for k-means clustering
      attempts - the number of attempts to run k-means
      centers - the output centers
      Returns:
      an array with the compactness score for each channel

    • cOmpare

      public org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat cOmpare(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat src, double[] cmpTo, int cmpop)
      Compare each channel of the image to the corresponding double in the array.
      Parameters:
      src - the image to compare
      cmpTo - the array of doubles to compare to
      cmpop - the comparison operator
      Returns:
      a 3 channel Mat with the comparison results

      public org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat cOmpare(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat src, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat cmpTo, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat dst, int cmpop)

      Parameters:

      cmpTo - the comparison Mat
      dst - the mask to set
      cmpop - the comparison operator
      Returns:
      the comparison mask

      public org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.MatVector mEanStdDev(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat src, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat mask)
      OpenCV's meanStdDev works with 3 channel images but only 1 channel masks (CV_8UC1)
      Parameters:
      src - the image to compute the mean and standard deviation of
      mask - the 3 channel mask to use
      Returns:
      the mean (index 0) and standard deviation (index 1) of the image

    • minIndex

      public void minIndex(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat minIndices, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat bestScores, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat challenger, int challengerIndex)
      updates the minimum indices and minimum scores for each channel
      Parameters:
      minIndices - a Mat with the current minimum indices, representing the images with the smallest scores
      bestScores - a Mat with the current best scores
      challenger - a Mat with the challenger values (image scores)
      challengerIndex - the index of the challenger

    • replace2DmaskWith3Dmat

      public org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat replace2DmaskWith3Dmat(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat mask, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat mat)

    • getIndicesOfMax

      public void getIndicesOfMax(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat maxValues, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat challenger, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat indices, int scalar)
      The indices Mat is reused to store the indices of the best scores. It is most likely passed to this method with the indices of the best scores from the previous iteration. The maxValues Mat is updated with the max values from the current iteration. The OpenCV function 'compare' only works on matrices with 1 channel. In this function, all channels are used and the challenger wins only when it has the highest value in the majority of the channels.
      Parameters:
      maxValues - the Mat with the largest values
      challenger - the Mat to compare it with
      indices - the destination Mat with indices
      scalar - the index corresponding to the challenger Mat

    • inrange

      public void inrange(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat src, org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat dst, int lowerb, int upperb)
      The inRange function of OpenCV will return a 1 channel mask, in which each cell is 255 if the corresponding cell in every channel of the source Mat matches the lower and upper bounds. This function will return a 3 channel mask where each cell is 255 if the cell in that channel matches the lower and upper bounds.
      Parameters:
      src - the source Mat
      dst - the destination Mat
      lowerb - the lower bound
      upperb - the upper bound

      Parameters:
